result.execSummary:
The defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: ***January 16. 2015,Judge J.D. Watts, COURT ORDERS probation term on count one to be commuted to one (1) year.***
Consecutive to:  any other sentence,  but concurrent to Count one.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral modification Program.
Court orders no drivers license suspension.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNTS  ONE AND TWO:  Pay DNA surcharge, court costs, victim witness surcharges. To be paid by 12/12/2016.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil  judgment.  
If revoked, DOC may collect from up to 25% of the defendant's prison funds. Balance to be paid by 12/12/16.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide a  DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program. 
Restitution set at zero.
**Conditions apply to both counts/case.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nancy A Schulz-Lassack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order Commuting Probation Term signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term (count one).

Amending Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction to reflect:
The HOC and Prison time in counts 1 and 2 are IMPOSED and STAYED for 2 years of probation, signed and filed. sab

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 months in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, concurrent to Count 2, credit for 0 days.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 1, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges to be paid by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. If revoked, DOC may collect from up to 25% of the defednant's prison funds.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 12/12/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. If revoked, DOC can collect from up to 25% of the defenant's prison funds.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Part time work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.
-Court orders no drivers license suspension
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 12/12/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 12-12-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for projected guilty plea.  For reasons stated on the record, defense requests a scheduling conference date. Court orders case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
This case is a possible DPA. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 9/25/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 15.   Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Benjamin Verhulst, student intern under the supervision of Nathanliel Adamson for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Travis Machalk-Wauwatosa Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Margaret A Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Student Intern Benjamin Verhulst under the supervision of ADA Kunisch.
Amended Information received and filed charging:  Count 1:  MISDEMEANOR RETAIL THEFT, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec(s) 943.50(1m)(b) and (4)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor; and Count 2:  POSSESSION OF NARCOTIC DRUGS, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec(s) 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 07-03-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of NO ILLEGAL DRUGS or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Motion to dismiss felony count 2 by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court without prejudice.

Defendant Nancy A Schulz-Lassack in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
